I've used Wysa off and on for a few years to vent without judgment and help reframe my thinking when I spiral. It works well for this and calms me down 95% of the time. That said, some of my problems are more complicated than what it knows (i.e., pregnancy hormones and/or PPD) and the techniques don't always make the most sense for them. Expanding on Wysa's knowledge or adding techniques would be great, though in the meantime, I'm happy with it considering it's free to use.

Wysa can be tremendously helpful for persons with C-PTSD. Previous coaching or therapy adds to the Wysa application's effective qualities. Wysa is the perfect tool for introverted people or those who experience strong, sudden and often debilitating emotional distress. This application should not be used in place of a licensed therapist but rather as a tool that assists those that are willing to put in the work towards their mental and physical sensory systems

Wysa is a great support for my mental and emotional health. The tools are effective in this context. The main negative review I would give is the fact that it is impersonal. It is definitely not focused on what I say, but rather the thinking pattern reframing. Therefore, because it's not a human and it forces me to follow the protocol, I cannot remain in the negative emotional cycle for long, which is good, but at the same time, there is an underlying feeling of not being properly acknowledged.

There are times when Wysa misunderstood, & the most awkward one was yesterday. I was worried for a friend who lives far away since she told me her panic disorder had returned. But then Wysa sent replies that misunderstood as if I was the one with panic disorder. Apart from that, I think this app is useful for those who want to pour their hearts out without the fear of being judged.
Very helpful,distressing. Though wish they had a calming/focus music option,like birds chirping or waves crashing.

AI often doesn't register what's going on in our conversations. It seems programmed to scan for trigger words (anxious, overwhelmed, depression, etc) and offer relief to those symptoms, regardless of whether that is necessary in the context of the conversation (e.g. I mention that I was an anxious child, and the chatbot will ask if I want it to teach me a coping mechanism). But I like having a conversational format to talk through my issues, and the coping mechanisms are great when I need them.

The experience here feels considerate. I dont feel forced, I just feel really understood and appreciated in a meaningful way.
Best app for reflecting on emotions. Thank you for making it free and ad-free!

I don't remember an app that good for a long time... Use it for the last couple of days on a regular basis. It looks great, easy to use and very informative. Great app if you want to understand/manage your emotions better. The real gem of the app are the little videos that are really interesting and helpful. Some of them are short meditations and others are information sharing. They are really well produced and short so they're easy to consume whenever you have two to three minutes to spare. Despite their short length, they are really helpful and insightful. I do wish you could just type in an emotion instead of scrolling through the big chart.

Wow. As a therapist I see it as a gold mine that allows all of us to learn more about our emotions than happy, sad, angry or anxious. It opens the world of understanding there are more shades to emotion. Infact it opens the technicolor range of emotions and provides tools to address troubling emotions in the moment.

Very useful app to monitor your emotions. When you have to pick an emotion, you are basically forced to analyse your feeling more deeply, thus gaining more knowledge on your personal mechanisms. However, i personally feel it is lacking some features: -possibility to have a mix of a couple of feelings -ability to set the intensity of the emotion Thank you for this great app. I feel like im on a journey to discover more of myself!

Best Mood Tracking app & tool. Based on The Mood Meter developed by Yale University Social Emotional Learning Center. Uses emotions and feeling language, where ironically many do not. Includes videos and quick strategies to improve your mood. I use this app myself and also recommend it to my clients. I cannot recommend The Mood Meter & this app enough!

It is an amazing app to track your moods. The best one I have found to date without any sort of advertising or misinformation. There are small helpful strategies provided along with tracking your moods. The analysis based on tags is highly informative to see the pattern that you might often miss on your own. Thank you for such applications. It's apps like these that truly inspire. Suggestion: Please add the feature to export our data and backup on cloud.

I was going to give it a 3 star because the notifications weren't working so I would never remember to use the app, making it useless. Phenomenal, non-invasive app for tracking emotions, causes, and trends. You have full access to and control of your data which you can export later if desired into a nice excel / notepad csv file. Unequivocally recommended.

Overall, "How We Feel" is a great tool for anyone looking to build self-awareness and incorporate emotional management techniques into their routine. It complements the psychological methods we have discussed in my class, such as mood monitoring, emotion regulation, and CBT, making it a helpful addition to the growing field of mental health apps. Even if I think the use of an AI assistent blocks real human connection and isn't a replacement for actual therapy.

I like checking in throughout the day, but I do wish there was a "neutral" option. Often I'm not necessarily feeling pleasant but I'm not feeling particularly /unpleasant/ either. Maybe neither, maybe a little of both with no identifiable reasoning. Neutral as an option would be nice, or at least being able to select multiple feelings at once.

very good it would be nice tho to not get the share popup every time, as it may feel annoying, and make it part of the emotion description UI or something similar also, it'd be nice too to have a graph like the one with all the emotions you felt that shows more check-ins :)

I love this app. The specific emotions to choose from are helpful. What do the shapes mean? I like that the videos are short - <2 minutes, although having longer options would be cool, too. Just started so still formulating a solid opinion. Seems to have a fair amount of resources. It vibrates when making selections. I really like the app, but if there is one thing I wish it can improve on is to be able to increase the font when typing. Otherwise it's really useful tool to understand our emotions.
edit: when trying to add another feeling to a check-in, the app crashes
Really good app! However I find it strange that I can only pick two emotions per check-in, feels quite restrictive as I can't fully describe how I feel in two words often. Other than that perfect :)
I really wish there was a smartwatch version!

Really nice and I like the analytics but I am frustrated that I can't add my own emotions. The iOS version allows for custom emotions. I feel like I don't get the best use because I'm missing major emotions I feel frequently and can't add them.

I love this app, I find it useful and cute. I'm actually not leaving a 5 star because I found a few "weird" details (that I think have to do with the graphic aspect) like options not showing (ex: if you use the lens tool to search for an emotion, you see some that aren't in the main selection screen. Or, in the "analyze" weather section, I see a graph for "foggy", the thing is "foggy" is not a selectable option. Why are things added in the app if they can't be easily found/used at all?)

This has been one of the best and most beneficial apps I have ever used. However, since the recent update, I have been experiencing a problem with sharing my feelings with friends. Although I send my feelings and it appears that they are shared, my friends do not receive them. This is really frustrating.
cannot share all my my check-ins with friends. Only one check in at a time. i want to see all the shared check-ins of friends in one day
App is great. But it won't let me enter my friends codes at all
Please add the option to lock the app

They listened to feedback on a backwards update and moved forward again. The only thing I wish this app did better is including a couple more emotions like manic and grieving or offering an option to edit emotions you wouldn't use. Overall this app has been super helpful for tracking my schizoaffective Bipolar episodes though I'm so glad I found it.

This is a really great app, I just wish it would let you customize the time of day you get notifications for check ins. I don't like that it considers 4am to be late night. EDIT: Satisfied with the time of day check ins, but now they've changed "Good/Okay" to just "Good", so now I have no neutral emotion to go to. I don't like that they don't have something that lets me describe a state in which im feeling neither positive or negative

I've recently started using the app and everything about it seems great. The UI is crisp and minimal. The exercises are great. I just don't like the streak feature. It gives me one more thing to be anxious about seriously.

Liking this app so far. Has the best interface and method of all of the emotion journaling apps I've tried. The only thing I've noticed is that if you add exercise to an feeling it gets added to all the feelings in that day, even before you do the exercise.

Love the app, particularly the (optional) social feature. However, I just realized there are many more emotions available than what is shown on the grid. Some of the hidden emotions are ones that I resonate more with than the default options ‚Äî it would be great if there was some way to customize the grid by swapping out hidden options for default ones, or otherwise "favoriting" hidden ones so they can be accessed quickly from the grid.
I'm loving my experience with it so far. I'm sure that other users would be looking for more ways for further engagement and learning. Looking forward to see how more this app would help.
It won't let me log in with Google to use the AI feature :( Other than that, this app is a blessing

It's great! I love having data points to track trends with. One thing that would make it better: some sort of feature that would help folks like me that suspect they have alexithymia. The grid is useful, but I can't always figure it out beyond picking a square, and I don't just mean verbalizing it. In the meantime I've added another app that aims at helping with that.

I think this is probably the best app I have come past. It's so simple and convenient. I think all generations would find this easy to use. I have some feedback, though, just to add more emotions like feeling messy (not sure how to describe that) and others. Thank you for this app!

I believe there should be an option to select multiple emotions at same time. Whenever i want to ckeck in, i realize i have been feeling 90% of this, 80% of that, so ignoring anotyer emotion feels discouraging. The UI of this app is extraordinary. The best UI ever.

Very much like the app, especially the ability to download data and how beautiful the UI is. I am having a big problem voice typing my feelings note, though. I've tried typing a voice note 100 times and its worked twice. Not sure if its my device or a common problem. Have sent an email to support. Also would love a desktop version.

This app is so good. It helps me jot down how I am feeling and you don't have to pay for it! Which is so good, usually you have to pay which is bad. You can also see what you have put over the time. You can get lessons! I just wish you could talk to someone about how your feeling because all you really do is write down how you are feeling üòï not talking about it. To make it better, they could add a robot to talk to. Over all the app is so good. I fully recommend to people with anxiety, adhd+ xxx
New update (Feb 3 update) cleared my friends list and sharing notifications work but in the app I can't see friends check ins
Prettu good. Ad free, nonprofit. But I can't sign in with my Google account, just says no credentials found.

My favorite feelings tracker I've tried so far. Would like it if there were a couple more options closer to 'neutral'. Would be awesome to have the option to select multiple feelings during a single check in.

Been using this app to not only help me but my therapist the last month or so now. And as someone who is on the spectrum who struggles to name specific/sub categories of emotions this app has been absolutely fantastic! Though I do wish they had a few more options for emotions as the ones I can name aren't on there. Besides that this all has been insanely helpful! However, since the last update the scrolling, in the emotions list, is jittery/laggy & freezes often. Still highly recommend the app!

I absolutely love this completely free, no ads app! It's extremely beneficial for creating mindfulness with becoming more aware of our emotions. Including a part to write about our feelings in the moment, and able to look back and read them. The only improvement I can think of is to include a way to track menstrual cycles, and how that effects emotions and well-being.
I really like this app it really helps me feel better and understand myself more it would be so much better if they added streak freezes

Brilliant app. As someone with suspected ADHD and Autism, its very hard for me to describe how I'm feeling. This app lays emotions out beautifully. However, I am having a bit of trouble with the "Grateful Moments" best self tool. whenever I select a photo, it crashes. other than that, I highly recommend!!
I like it but I wish there was more emotions. Especially neutral emotions like apathy.
I have been waiting for you for 3 days to remind me, and ask me how I feel. But there is no notification even though I have activated it. I jsut wanted to be reminded -_-

I just started using this app and I love all the mood options and how there's a description for each one. One thing I would like is the ability to add different categories for the tags as I like to organize a lot of things. Also, being able to look at a calendar view of all the entries would be nice. It's a great app though!
It's really helping with my emotional regulation

This app is amazing, and I am surprised that it's free. I want to use it in order to also bring along in therapy. Though for that I would prefer if this app also existed in my native language, also because it makes far more sense to me to express my feelings in my native language. (I'd even translate it for free, if that would make a version in my language possible...)
good app, I don't use it as a journal since I have one in paper but it is nuce to help identify your emotions

App is great. I especially love the "learn" section. You can see trends for the week/month, why can't you view by day on that same page and see the actual entries?
Could use more variety and mixed moods but overall love the app and haven't experienced much glitchiness either

Absolutely fantastic app! As others have noted, it would be nice to have a "neutral" option, and the Reflect ai doesn't appear to work on my Android phone. Other than that, very helpful tool to help in my recovery.
I wish we could say our day end later than midnight but exept that its a really good app!

Great app, helped me so much, first step to understanding yourself is actually being able to recognize yoyr feelings, however I have few concerns about my data sinxe the weekly digest reads my notes (it's Ai) and oft they're private to me

I enjoy this app a lot, especially now that it isn't prompting me for surveys. I do wish they would generate more useful data about my check-ins. I'll keep using it but I hope they add more data features.

I like the thought of adding my feelings and being able to track them. However every time I open this app it's like I'm starting new. It doesn't seem to recognize that I have been in before and logged anything.

Very VERY disappointed to see this app adding an AI component. I've recommended this app to lots of people, but I can't in good conscience do that if it involves something as environmentally harmful and blatantly flawed as AI. Pre-AI, 5 stars. With AI, 3.
I love the design. It's unique and beautiful but the notifications/reminders don't work right. I set a schedule but the notifications are often hours late or don't happen at all.

Great app, however no widgets for this app for updates is a Lil frustrating. I will improve my review if they add widgets. also, some of the permissions this app uses feels un needed

Does what I wanted it to use for, namely, it tracks my emotions over time. But too many features that I just don't need, for a parson with ADHD it's confusing and discouraging. I will be using it for now, until I find something that fits my needs better.
Has quite some bugs on Android, the app stops when I go to the friends tab, also when I open the app by clicking on the notification it is almost unusable

I like this app because it doesn't do much. Collect small data drips 2 or 3 times most days in 30 to 60 seconds(!) & 2-minute videos if you have time. I don't often. Type a few words for context. Does it snow in my backyard but a heatwave in front? No. I demand you enter weather auto without it.

Well designed app with a good mission behind it which I support. I love this app for the most part and how you can upload multiple moods per day but I've been experiencing a technical issue. Whenever I try to set a mood to an earlier time of day the app crashes. This has been great for understanding my emotions so far. I really like all the details you can add to each entry, but there is a problem. When I tap on it, it gives me two options as if the photo were still there, "Remove" and "Replace". The photos are important visual representations for me and they help me remember the moment.
One thing that makes me dislike this app is that it forces me to choose between positive or negative moods. More often than not I'm neutral, neither up nor down. What about just being ok???

I won't lie, I very much enjoy this app since I've found it. it's definitely an interesting alternative to Dailyio. however it's missing a major feature that makes it hard to recommend (hence -2 stars): there's no 'Restore.' you guys have the backup feature, which is great. but for a journalling/mood-app, it's kind of imperative to have a way to restore the app from the csv files... you'd likely also get more concerts with such a feature (w/ a guide on structuring data from other apps)

The easiest to use and my favorite of all the ones I've tried but I wish there was a way to add your own emotions because there are some that I would use frequently to describe myself that aren't listed

A recommend mood tracking app. Bright and colourful & easy to use most of the way. Great idea but some flaws. No way to export your data so it'll be forever trapped on your phone (this despite a feature to share content with friends which seems a super odd rationale. I liked this app until I realized the developer thinks he or she knows better than all the rest of us and refuses to listen to user feedback. for all the large vocabulary, the emotional descriptors are still limited (mostly redundant, also where is "hostility"?). also the padding in the journal entry field is so small I have a hard time typing and editing entries. I've mentioned both a year ago; nothing's changed. you get what you pay for I guess. time for me to make my own app.

This app has been great. Unfortunately since downloading the new update today, I'm not able to click on or update my sleep hours or exercise. Anyone else? Please fix this! I like to record patterns and I know the data is supportive but this update, truthfully, isn't any better than the one before. It wasn't broken, why fix it? Now it seems broken.

Feels a bit wrong that there is no place for neutral feelings, as most of the time I dont feel neither pleasant or unpleasant emotions. I tried it out because I love the Instagram. Logging your emotions is simple & intuitive which is ideal. I like the line graph display. The toolbox addition would be very useful & practical. The design and art are not my favorite and overall I prefer an alternative emotional journal app to this one (Dailyo).

The idea of this is great, though this hasn't been all that helpful to me. I often can't find the right feeling, and several of the words provided are not actual emotions (for instance, "betrayed" is not an emotion but an interpretation).

incredible app !! i just wish there was a way to sync data between phones, like creating an account or just an option to export&import data. i'd hate to lose all my data after switching to a new phone

Update 10/25: was loving this app til the recent update created all these dang pop-ups about this or that. Please get rid of the annoying pop-ups.... Original: As a therapist I use and appreciate this app for myself and also recommend it to many clients. My clients also express really appreciating the app. From the helpful ways to do check ins, the space to elaborate, and the analyzing/tracking of emotions, this is an all-around useful app.

I really like this app. I like the breadth of emotions readily available to choose from, as opposed to something like Daylio where I have to come up with all of the emotions (and must pay to have more than 5 default). However I wish there were a "neutral" mood category. it is a good app but the AI responses for suggesting affirmation etc still feels too stiff, need to be more casual.

The idea behind this app is great, but it could be better executed. First, the reminders that I set haven't worked for over a week now. When they did work, they were always late. Second, it's too limiting by only allowing you to pick one feeling at a time. We rarely feel only one feeling. I realize this is free, but if they can't make it work better, it's not even worth the price of your time or energy.

It's a great start, but I'd really love to see some of the breakdowns done in a more helpful way. The data analysis they have for individual categories isn't really helpful for determining patterns of feelings... But it's great foe a birds eye view.

It is fine, but often I don't want to include lots of information regarding the feeling. It also does not some major feelings, like distracted. I just want to be able to select feeling I feel that day without assigning a story, time, etc. or have to skip past those every time. This app is neat, but has way too much to go through every time

Good idea, but it's 50/50 on whether the notifications will actually pop up to remind you to check in. Kinda defeats the purpose of the app if you have to rely on your own memory to check in and therefore do so inconsistently.

I used to give this 5 stars and recommended it to everyone. The app forced me to do an update and now I probably won't use it anymore. This app can be a five. Tldr: If you've been in therapy for a number of years you may find Youper a bit too shallow. I don't like how this app makes me feel like my mental health is a commodity nor do I like that the app doesn't actually do anything until you sign on to the subscription. However, therapy and finding a therapist that you like is expensive & I think this app is a cheaper alternative. If you feel that this would serve you well on your journey then please do what you feel is best but I don't recommend.

This app used to be free and now it's like 69.99 a year. The quality was fine and acceptable for a free app, but it's really not worth 69.99 a year. Plus I also think it's pretty incredibly rude of them to have pulled the rug out from under people who were using this app in its free capacity to lock some of the old free features behind a paywall. Insulting and gross of them really. If they wanted to monetize they should have only added additional NEW features to pay for and kept old ones free.

Dissapointed to see previous free features are now locked behind paywall. It's one thing to add new features that require payment, but to remove previously free core features like examining thinking traps and breathing exercise then place them behind payment feels like this app has lost track of its main mission and is now just a glorified mood tracker.
everything is behind a paywall, no point is downloading this app
Used to be good, free, and accessible. Now it's not. More money-grubbing at the expense of actual mental betterment.

If you are new to meditation or have been dismissive of meditation because your mind is horribly busy, then Headspace is for you! I've used the app since 2021 and I can't imagine life without Eve, Andy, Dora, Sam, and Kessonga. I am AuDHD and I found the entire process affirming, meeting me where I'm at instead of merely lecturing me. You can set your own mindfulness goals, and record your findings. Customer service is awesome, and the price point is reasonable compared to other apps.

It really helps me to stay with the discipline of meditating. They have an option of just five breaths, an animation often set in nature, with soothing sounds like birds or the sound of the surf. But they have some, like one with a balloon, where the sounds in the background are kids yelling at a playground. For me - not soothing. But otherwise it's been very helpful. I like how non judgmental, it is. There are options for 3 minutes to 20, which lets me do a little bit If that's all I can.

I don't wish to sound like a TED-talker, but by helping you develop your meditation daily practice, Headspace can actually change your life.

As someone who's always on the go, I never got into breathing exercises or mindfulness, despite wanting to for years. I got Headspace 3-4 years ago and eased into it very gradually. I am grateful for the accessibility of the 1-3 minute exercises in particular, which offered a gateway to slowly making mindfulness part of my busy life. I now do ~15 minutes per day. I wouldn't say this lightly about an app, but this one is a tool that has helped me change my life for the better.

I've noticed great benefits from this particular mediation. It took me a long while to finally crack it, but when I did, the difference in me was amazing. I noticed vastly improved concentration, less anxious thoughts, I am a lot more present, more observant and more mindful. I'm less ruled by strong emotions, more content. With others, I'm more sympathetic, less grumpy, slower to judge or criticise. It's been a real game changer for me.

I'm coming back to use Headspace after a several month absence, and the strong haptic vibration attached to almost every control in the app makes it unpleasant to use. I have my haptics set to the lowest level without turning it off completely. I'm neurodivergent and need to have some feedback, but this max level feeling is so overstimulating that I may have to look for an alternative.
Content is decent, price is high. App takes almost 3-4 minutes to load, not sure they want to teach us patience through this type of extremely slow application by design.

When I first got the app it wanted to make me sign up for a trial. I clicked the x and I couldn't do anything without doing the trial. And there were Ads. Unless you don't want to sign up for the trial I would not get this app.üò†

I like the content and have been a subscriber for years. However, the app, despite its look and feel, doesn't work very smoothly. I sometimes cannot load the "Today" page, and the video and guide do not work as expected. It auto stop after 1 second. The overall experience with the app has been up and down for me. I hope the issues will be fixed soon because the price is hefty for a meditation app.
Useful app, but almost everything is locked for premium.
Feel overwhelmed. Have not been on this app in a long time. But now I got to pay for it? What a nasty welcome back to what I felt could help me in this hard time.

You literally can't do anything if you won't subscribe with your credit card to do the free trial. Every single thing was locked. With other apps you get examples in each category to at least get a feel for the app, this one literally allows nothing except making an account...once I did that, I couldn't listen to anything without a credit card. Member support is very minimal and I sometimes don't get answers for days and have to follow up even with a paid plan from my work. Coaches come and go frequently so you're always working with a new person. The automated classes/breathing exercises are helpful. For some reason I'm not getting notifications even with them turned on in settings.

I really like the structure and content, but the app engineering is terrible. It crashes constantly. I get notifications from my phone asking if I want to uninstall it due to how many crashes occur. I've had multiple support cases due to courses not advancing. The tech stress offsets the goal to create calm. CTO: allocate budget to fix your broken MVP! If you weren't free from my health insurance provider, I wouldn't pay for this app. It's glitchy AF.

I originally got the app a long time ago and had the free version for a while. I then bought the subscription for the stress package. This really helped. However, since then the app seems to gradually be getting worse and will turn itself off in the middle of a meditation or a soundscape while you're trying to sleep. This means that whenever there is a pause in a meditation, I'm left wondering if the app has gone off again or if I'm still in the guided meditation, which causes anxiety.

So simple, to a fault.I can't remember why I stopped using this app first, but now I'm starting to recall. There's no way to favourite on the web app. I FINALLY figured out the audio controls, but they're very clunky if you just want to jump back if you were interrupted. The courses are confusing. The one I tried said that it assumes I've listened to the "Headspace Foundations", but when I search, there are no results. It then referenced a "Headspace single" but wouldn't specify the name. Grrr.
Good app, helped me change my lifestyle, but takes up too much storage.
Nice

Used this app for years with success but unfortunately now it's become so bloated that it's hard to find what you want in a timely manner. I eventually stopped using it and unsubscribed. Hopefully they consider stripping it down similar to how it use to be.

Headspace feels extremely forced and one-size-fits all. No personalizing. Also, the opposite of smart. If I'm using it at 2:30 in the morning, chances are I need help sleeping. The app knows the time. Why doesn't it prompt me right to the "go to sleep" content? Likewise, it offers no diversity in the age of coaches. We all find different voices soothing. For me, the voice of an elderly gentleman would be grounding, centering and soothing. But that doesn't seem to be an option anywhere.

New users stay away. They've focused too much on making content and lost any simplicity. Every so often I try to get into meditation, so I open up the app and try to start their Basics series again. It's now so hidden in the mess of content that I can't find it. Sure I can find the fifth lesson, but restarting is hidden somewhere. By focusing for repeat users, they're no longer useful for new ones.

Why would you get therapy from a program?

There's two kinds of therapy: running the CBT script/framework, and providing empathy and understanding. Both have their uses, but it's much easier to "do" CBT, because it's already basically an algorithm. I'm giving one star because the onboarding process misled me to believing this AI is *also* capable of the latter. In reality, its "emotional support/good listener/kind understanding" is just a token "I understand that you feel that way" immediately followed by CBT problem solving.

It's ok on the surface and I found it alright for a little while. But you start to see the same advice over and over and over again. Meditation and deep breathing are not the answers to all my problems. It keeps suggesting I bake some healthy alternatives despite the fact that I told it over and over that I don't have an oven. Recently it stopped processing my sessions properly as well, so I don't know what I'm paying for exactly. I'm pausing my subscription because it isn't worth it.

7 Cups - Anxiety & Stress Chat is an amazing app that offers both members and listeners support. Members can connect with trained listeners for emotional help, and listeners have access to free training and self-help resources. The app also provides a space for members to share their issues, and the trained listeners help with guidance. For serious issues like self-harm, helplines are available. Best of all, everything is free, making the app a valuable resource for anyone in need of support.
This app has been a source of support for me since my teenage years. Now that I‚Äôve gained a stronger grasp on my mental health, I‚Äôve chosen to give back by becoming a listener!

Know what you're getting into. Unless you pay to talk to a licensed therapist, then be aware you're talking to unlicensed volunteers. It's the same as if you walked up to a stranger on the street and poured out your personal life story to them. You never know what they might say or how they may react. If you're under emotional duress, this may not be the best option for you. You may get triggered. I deleted the app because I kept having bad experiences. Use caution when using this platform.
